'It's dooone!'%K%P
Akane flopped down on the tatami floor in the living\nroom after laundry was done.%K%P
'Thanks for your help, Akane.\nAre you getting used to the chores?'%K%P
After Akane decided to become an idol, I made her\nhelp with chores so she could get used to the way\nway humans lived.%K%P
'Laundry, what a drag. I can't believe you\ndo it every day.'%K%P
'I only handle a tiny portion of it.\nMaika's the impressive one,\nshe handles it all like it's nothing.'%K%P
'Augh. There's no way I could handle chores\nevery day.'%K%P
'Really? You've been a great help recently.'%K%P
'You think? I don't really know.'%K%P
Akane seemed doubtful, but her attitude towards\nliving has been changing for sure.%K%P
Hopefully everything goes well with controlling\nher Jinriki.%K%P
'I'm back.'%K%P
'Welcome back, Inori.'%K%P
'Welcome home!'%K%P
I served cold barley tea to Inori, who took a seat on\none of the floor cushions.%K%P
'Here you go, Inori.'%K%P
'Thank you very much, Sho.'%K%P
'My pleasure. How was the meeting with your boss?'%K%P
Inori was called to report on the progress\nof Akane's rehabilitation.%K%P
They'd been working really hard recently.\nI'd been sure it went well.%K%P
'Yes. I reported about Akane's recent situation.\nI received some feedback about it, but...'%K%P
'But?'%K%P
'Well, it wasn't a very favorable reaction.\nThey're pushing me to try harder\nat her rehabilitation.'%K%P
'Ugh, what's up with that?'%K%P
'I don't wanna try any harder than now.\nEspecially since I haven't even been\npracticing at all these days.'%K%P
'I-It should be fine.\nYou're doing your best, Akane.'%K%P
'Inori's right. Even if other goddesses don't see it,\nwe know you're doing a remarkable job, Akane.'%K%P
'I know that, but...\nUgh, it still bugs me!'%K%P
'Whoa!'%K%P
In reaction to Akane's rage, the power in\nthe room went out.%K%P
I tried to encourage Akane so she wouldn't give up,\nbut she still seemed very bothered.%K%P
'Akane, I understand your frustration,\nbut the boss won't be too happy\nabout you causing blackouts.'%K%P
'I know...I know, but, I can't help it that it\nbugs me!'%K%P
Blackouts kept happening, since one explosion of\nanger wasn't enough for Akane.%K%P
'So it was Akane getting angry, causing all the\nblackouts.'%K%P
'Hey, Maika.'%K%P
While I was trying to come up with ways to calm\nAkane down, Maika came back from school.%K%P
'You're early today.'%K%P
'Today was a half day because of a test.\nSo, what happened?'%K%P
'Well...'%K%P
I updated Maika with the situation according\nto what Inori told me.%K%P
'Hmm. Maybe rehabilitation is impossible by becoming\nan idol?'%K%P
'Well, you can't deny the fact that Akane\naccomplished quite a bit recently, right?'%K%P
'Maybe a little. But since she can't recognize her\nown efforts, she's more miserable than ever.'%K%P
'It's true. I wonder why that is.'%K%P
'If nothing comes to mind, how about we just stop?'%K%P
While I was racking my brains over it, Maika\nsuggested that as if it wasn't a big deal.%K%P
'What do you mean?'%K%P
'No matter how hard we think, the blackouts\naren't going to stop overnight. So why don't we\ntake a break?'%K%P
'You still have some time. It might be better in the \nlong run if you take a break for a bit.'%K%P
A break, huh?%K%P
I'd been pushing myself a lot recently, so she\nmight have a point.%K%P
'There, sounds like they stopped fighting.\nWhy don't you go talk to them?\nI'll go prepare lunch for us.'%K%P
'All right. Will do.'%K%P
'A break?! I'm in, I'm in!\nI've been waiting for something like that!'%K%P
'It's nice to take a break from time to time.'%K%P
When I brought it up to both of them,\nthey agreed to it right away.%K%P
They were already planning their day after lunch.%K%P
What should I do?%K
